Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Republicans controlled both the executive and legislative branches of government from 1921-30, not just in 1928.
Falters at times: The claim falters by suggesting that the Great Depression was solely caused by Republican control in 1928, ignoring the multi-faceted causes of the economic downturn.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to establish a direct causal link between Republican control in 1928 and the onset of the Great Depression.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the last time Republicans controlled the presidency and Congress was in 1928, when in fact there have been other instances since then.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge alternative explanations for the causes of the Great Depression, such as the role of international economic factors and financial speculation.
